docs.abstract: Should it be illegal for businesses to discriminate against unhealthy and heavily overweight applicants?
docs.snippet: Should it be illegal for businesses to discriminate against unhealthy and heavily overweight applicants?

docs.lead_paragraph: The short, brutish life of the bulldog is putting the future of the breed at risk.
docs.abstract: Veterinarians, breeders and animal-welfare experts are beginning to question whether it is ethically defensible to continue breeding certain types of dogs, with a specific focus on the British bulldog; the British bulldog is unique in that it is significantly more likely than other dogs to suffer from a wide range of health issues stemming from over- and in-breeding.
docs.snippet: The short, brutish life of the bulldog is putting the future of the breed at risk.

headline.main: An Electronic Eye on Hospital Hand-Washing

docs.abstract: A video monitoring system is helping to increase hand-washing rates and reduce deadly hospital-acquired infections.
docs.snippet: A video monitoring system is helping to increase hand-washing rates and reduce deadly hospital-acquired infections.

docs.lead_paragraph: Beeps and blinking lights are the constant chatter of a hospital intensive care unit, but at the I.C.U.'s in North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, N.Y., the conversation has some unusual contributors.  Two L.E.D. displays adorn the wall across from each nurses' station.  They show the hand hygiene rate achieved:  last Friday in the surgical I.C.U., the weekly rate was 85 percent and the current shift had a rate of 91 percent.  "Great Shift!!" the sign said.   At the medical I.C.U. next door, the weekly rate was 81 percent, and the current shift 82 percent.

headline.main: An Electronic Eye on Hospital Hand-Washing

docs.abstract: A video monitoring system is helping to increase hand-washing rates and reduce deadly hospital-acquired infections.
docs.snippet: A video monitoring system is helping to increase hand-washing rates and reduce deadly hospital-acquired infections.

docs.lead_paragraph: The decisions by the fund, which raises most of the money spent fighting AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria, come after questions about how rigorously its disbursements have been overseen.

headline.seo: Global AIDS Fund Will Pause New Grants and Seek New Manager
headline.main: Global Fund Will Pause New Grants and Seek New Manager
headline.print_headline: Global Fund Shelves Fund-Raising Plan and Will Seek New Manager

docs.snippet: The decisions by the fund, which raises most of the money spent fighting AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria, come after questions about how rigorously its disbursements have been overseen.

docs.lead_paragraph: The F.D.A. was right to revoke its approval of the drug as a treatment for breast cancer when its side effects outweighed its benefits for most patients.
docs.abstract: Editorial asserts that the Food and Drug Administration was right to withdraw its approval for the drug Avastin as a treatment for breast cancer after scientific evidence showed the drug was not as effective as it first seemed and that its severe side effects outweighed the benefits.
docs.snippet: The F.D.A. was right to revoke its approval of the drug as a treatment for breast cancer when its side effects outweighed its benefits for most patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senescent cells seem to be a benign by-product of the body’s defense against cancer, but researchers are growing suspicious of their culpability in aging.

headline.seo: In Body’s Shield Against Cancer, a Culprit in Aging May Lurk
headline.main: In Body’s Shield Against Cancer, a Culprit in Aging May Lurk
headline.print_headline: In Body’s Shield Against Cancer, a Culprit in Aging May Lurk

docs.abstract: Study conducted by the Mayo Clinic and published in journal Nature finds that mice tissue remains more youthful and vigorous after it is purged of senescent cells, which linger in body even after they lose ability to divide; although genetic purging method cannot be applied to people, startling result could potentially lead to methods for delaying diseases related to aging.
docs.snippet: Senescent cells seem to be a benign by-product of the body’s defense against cancer, but researchers are growing suspicious of their culpability in aging.
